newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: ASEAN sets integrated study on power grid.
newsitem.headline: ASEAN sets integrated study on power grid.

text.p: Energy ministers of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) on Wednesday agreed to conduct a feasiblity study on an ASEAN electricity grid.

Philippine Energy Minister Francisco Viray, chairman and spokesman of the 15th ASEAN Energy Ministers Meeting, told a news briefing the feasibility study will integrate existing studies by new members of the group.
Viray said Australian Aid has offered to finance the study which will likely start within the year.

Philippine president Fidel Ramos who spoke prior to the meeting called on ASEAN to encourage private sector involvement in energy projects such as the proposed 8,000 kilometre trans-ASEAN gas pipeline.
Viray said the ministers had not acted on a study completed last year on a gas pipeline project.

The ministers also agreed to institutionalise the ASEAN Energy Business Forum (AEBF). The inaugural forum held last month in Singapore was expected to act as a venue for cooperation between government and private sector in energy projects.
The Philippines will host the second AEBF next year.
ASEAN groups Brunei, Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines, Singapore, Thailand and Vietnam. Its new members are Laos, Myanmar and Cambodia.
The ministers welcomed the participation of the new ASEAN members to the next meeting in Singapore in 1998.
